On top of Mount Sumeru is the second heaven, the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials. The Heavenly Emperor is named Indra, with majestic blessings and virtues, in charge of the four heavens.

The Four Heavenly Kings are the Four Guardian Kings. Each governs one direction. On the eighth day of each month, they send messengers down to inspect the world, observing the thoughts, words, and deeds of emperors, ministers, the people, dragons, flying insects, crawling creatures, and all moving beings, to see if they are good or evil;
On the fourteenth day, they send their princes down;
On the fifteenth day, the Four Heavenly Kings themselves come down;
On the twenty-third day, the messengers come down again;
On the twenty-ninth day, the princes come down again;
On the thirtieth day, the Four Heavenly Kings themselves come down again.
When the Four Heavenly Kings come down, the sun, moon, five planets, and twenty-eight lunar mansions, as well as the gods within them, all come down together.

This is all due to the five precepts, ten wholesome [deeds], restraining one's emotions and desires, and the six days of observance!
